description_txt: stated on October 20, 2016 in in a debate:
quote_txt: Says Donald Trump "used undocumented labor to build the Trump Tower."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2016 in the third presidential debate:
quote_txt: When Hillary Clinton "ran the State Department, $6 billion was missing. How do you miss $6 billion? You ran the State Department, $6 billion was either stolen — they don't know."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2016 in the third 2016 presidential debate:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton "wanted the wall."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2016 in the third 2016 presidential debate:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton's "plan is going to raise taxes and even double your taxes."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2016 in the third 2016 presidential debate:
quote_txt: "We have 17 intelligence agencies, civilian and military, who have all concluded that these espionage attacks, these cyberattacks, come from the highest levels of the Kremlin, and they are designed to influence our election."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2016 in the third 2016 presidential debate:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton "wants to have open borders."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2016 in the third 2016 presidential debate:
quote_txt: "What the District of Columbia was trying to do (with its handgun ban) was to protect toddlers from guns."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2016 in the third 2016 presidential debate:
quote_txt: "We have 33,000 people a year who die from guns."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2016 in the third presidential debate:
quote_txt: "Heroin .. pours across our southern borders."

description_txt: stated on October 14, 2016 in a mailer:
quote_txt: "When Rachel Zenzinger was on the Arvada City Council, she voted to spend taxpayer funds for a junket to China."

description_txt: stated on October 14, 2016 in in a Ohio senatorial candidate debate:
quote_txt: Says Sen. Rob Portman said, "It would be irresponsible not to cut Medicare."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2016 in a speech in Green Bay, Wisconsin:
quote_txt: "It’s possible that non-citizen voters were responsible for Obama’s 2008 victory in North Carolina."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2016 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "State Department officials actually directed contracts for the Haitian recovery after the earthquake to friends of the Clintons."

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2016 in a U.S. Congressional campaign debate:
quote_txt: Colorado saw "increased incidents of emergency room visits by young people" and "increased incidents of driving while under the influence of marijuana" following the legalization of recreational pot.

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2016 in a U.S. Congressional campaign debate:
quote_txt: Says the U.S. Attorney’s Office said "that neither I nor my campaign had any idea what was going on" regarding my father's illegal campaign contributions. "And that’s why they closed this case."

description_txt: stated on October 10, 2016 in a U.S. Senate debate:
quote_txt: Says Sen. John McCain "has taken more money from Wall Street than any other sitting senator."

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2016 in a debate:
quote_txt: "Gov. (Pat) McCrory took $500,000 directly out of the disaster relief fund. And you know what it’s for? House Bill 2."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2016 in social media sites:
quote_txt: Creflo Dollar has endorsed Republican Donald Trump for president.

description_txt: stated on August 9, 2016 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "During his 18-year Senate career, (Russ Feingold) supported judges who voted to deny your individual Second Amendment right. … (He) promises to protect those rights, but that's not what his record shows."

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2016 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: "Sen. (Richard) Burr voted no on the Violence Against Women Act."

description_txt: stated on October 10, 2016 in a rally in Detroit:
quote_txt: "Back in the Great Recession, when millions of  jobs across America hung in the balance, Donald Trump said rescuing the auto industry didn’t really matter very much. He said, and I quote again, ‘Let it go.’ "

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2016 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says that compared to direct sales by manufacturers, consumers "save avg of $500 per car sold through franchised dealer model."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2016 in a U.S. Senate debate in Orlando:
quote_txt: "Not even Tim Kaine is willing" to say he trusts Hillary Clinton.

description_txt: stated on October 9, 2016 in the second presidential debate:
quote_txt: "Many of (Hillary Clinton's) friends took bigger deductions (than me). Warren Buffett took a massive deduction. (George) Soros, who is a friend of hers, took a massive deduction."

description_txt: stated on October 9, 2016 in the second presidential debate:
quote_txt: Says Warren Buffett has publicly said his secretary "should not be paying a higher tax rate" than him.

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2016 in a U.S. Senate debate:
quote_txt: "In about three weeks over a half million Floridians are going to lose their coverage again" through Obamacare.

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2016 in a campaign tweet:
quote_txt: Says Republican U.S. Rep. Bob Dold "continues to side with his Republican leadership and the NRA in blocking consideration of a bill that would keep firearms out of the hands of people on the terrorist watch list."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2016 in a U.S. Senate debate:
quote_txt: "When asked about equal pay for women, (Rubio’s) quote was that it was a waste of time."

description_txt: stated on October 13, 2016 in a speech:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton was "let off the hook" for her email scandal while Gen. David Petraeus had his life "destroyed for doing far, far less."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • October 18, 2016

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2016 in a U.S. Senate debate in Orlando:
quote_txt: "Marco Rubio made it clear: Not only does he think Donald Trump is a con man, he went on to say he doesn't trust Donald Trump with the nuclear codes."
